00048   const char *usage_str = 
00049   "\n" \
00050   "usage: code_search_and_replace [OPTIONS] <file> [ <file> ...]\n" \
00051   "\n" \
00052   "OPTIONS";
00053 
00054   struct lt_decreasing_length {
00055     bool operator()(const pair<string, string> &m1, const pair<string, string> &m2) const {
00056       if (m1.first == m2.first) {
00057         cout << "error: multiple mappings for '" << m1.first << "'" << endl;
00058         exit(1);
00059       }
00060       return m1.first.length() >= m2.first.length();
00061     }
00062   };
00063

00073 int main(int argc, char **argv) {
00074   vector< pair<string, string> > exchange_strings;
00075   string converted_contents;
00076   string orig_name;
00077   string backup_name;
00078   string license_name;
00079   char *ptr;
00080 
00081   System::initialize(argv[0]);
00082 
00083   try {
00084 
00085     po::options_description generic(usage_str);
00086     generic.add_options()
00087       ("help", "Display this help message")
00088       ("map-file", po::value<string>(), "File containing lines of string mappings of the form:  <from> '\\t' <to>")
00089       ("mapping", po::value< vector<string> >(), "String mapping.  Example: --mapping=\"foo\\tbar\"")
00090       ("license-file", po::value<string>(), "File containing source code header comment")
00091       ;
00092 
00093     // Hidden options: server location
00094     po::options_description hidden("Hidden options");
00095     hidden.add_options()
00096       ("input-file", po::value< vector<string> >(), "input file")
00097       ;
00098 
00099     po::options_description cmdline_options;
00100     cmdline_options.add(generic).add(hidden);
00101 
00102     po::positional_options_description p;
00103     p.add("input-file", -1);
00104 
00105     po::variables_map vm;
00106     store(po::command_line_parser(argc, argv).
00107           options(cmdline_options).positional(p).run(), vm);
00108     po::notify(vm);
00109 
00110     if (vm.count("help") || vm.count("input-file") == 0) {
00111       cout << generic << "\n";
00112       return 1;
00113     }
00114 
00115     if (vm.count("map-file") == 0 && vm.count("license-file") == 0 && vm.count("mapping") == 0) {
00116       cout << "error: --map-file, --mapping, and/or --license-file must be supplied." << endl;
00117       return 1;
00118     }
00119 
00120     vector<string> input_file, mapping;
00121 
00122     input_file = vm["input-file"].as< vector<string> >();
00123 
00124     if (vm.count("mapping"))
00125       mapping = vm["mapping"].as< vector<string> >();
00126 
00127     if (vm.count("license-file"))
00128       license_name = vm["license-file"].as<string>();
00129 
00130     for (size_t i=0; i<mapping.size(); i++) {
00131       if ((ptr = strstr(mapping[i].c_str(), "\\t")) == 0) {
00132         cout << "error: bad mapping - " << mapping[i] << endl;
00133         return 1;
00134       }
00135       *ptr = 0;
00136       ptr += 2;
00137       exchange_strings.push_back( make_pair(mapping[i].c_str(), ptr) );
00138     }
00139 
00140     if (vm.count("map-file")) {
00141       std::ifstream mappings_in( vm["map-file"].as< string >().c_str() );
00142       std::string line;
00143 
00144       while (getline(mappings_in, line)) {
00145         boost::trim(line);
00146         if (line != "") {
00147           char *line_ptr = (char *)line.c_str();
00148           if ((ptr = strstr(line_ptr, "\t")) == 0) {
00149             cout << "error: bad mapping - " << line << endl;
00150             return 1;
00151           }
00152           *ptr++ = 0;
00153           exchange_strings.push_back( make_pair(line_ptr, ptr) );
00154         }
00155       }
00156     }
00157 
00158     {
00159       struct lt_decreasing_length sort_obj;
00160       sort(exchange_strings.begin(), exchange_strings.end(), sort_obj);
00161     }
00162 
00163     for (size_t i=0; i<input_file.size(); i++) {
00164       converted_contents = "";
00165       cout << "Converting '" << input_file[i] << "'" << endl << flush;
00166       if (!convert_file(input_file[i], license_name, exchange_strings, converted_contents))
00167         cerr << "Problem converting '" << input_file[i] << "'" << endl;
00168       else {
00169         orig_name = input_file[i];
00170         backup_name = input_file[i] + ".old";
00171         unlink(backup_name.c_str());
00172         rename(orig_name.c_str(), backup_name.c_str());
00173         {
00174           ofstream fout(input_file[i].c_str());
00175           fout << converted_contents;
00176           fout.close();
00177         }
00178       }
00179     }
00180 
00181   }
00182   catch(exception& e) {
00183     cerr << "error: " << e.what() << "\n";
00184   }
00185   catch(...) {
00186     cerr << "Exception of unknown type!\n";
00187   }
00188 
00189 }

00191 namespace {
00192 
00193   typedef struct {
00194     off_t offset;
00195     const char *fromString;
00196     const char *toString;
00197   } ReplaceInfoT;
00198 
00199   struct ltReplaceInfo {
00200     bool operator()(const ReplaceInfoT &ri1, const ReplaceInfoT &ri2) const {
00201       return ri1.offset < ri2.offset;
00202     }
00203   };
00204 
00205   bool convert_file(string input_filename, string license_filename, vector< pair<string, string> > &exchange_strings, string &converted_contents) {
00206     off_t lastOffset, flen, license_len;
00207     char *fcontents = FileUtils::file_to_buffer(input_filename.c_str(), &flen);
00208     char *ptr = fcontents;
00209     char *codeStart, *base;
00210     ReplaceInfoT rinfo;
00211     vector<ReplaceInfoT> riVec;
00212 
00213     if (fcontents == 0)
00214       return false;
00215 
00216     if (license_filename != "") {
00217       
00218       converted_contents = FileUtils::file_to_buffer(license_filename.c_str(), &license_len);
00219 
00220       boost::trim(converted_contents);
00221       converted_contents += "\n\n";
00222 
00223       while (true) {
00224 
00225         while (*ptr && isspace(*ptr))
00226           ptr++;
00227 
00228         if (strncmp(ptr, "/*", 2)) {
00229           cerr << "Comment header not found in '" << input_filename << "'" << endl;
00230           return false;
00231         }
00232 
00233         if ((ptr = strstr(ptr, "*/")) == 0) {
00234           cerr << "Unable to find end of comment header in '" << input_filename << "'" << endl;
00235           return false;
00236         }
00237 
00238         ptr += 2;
00239 
00240         while (*ptr && isspace(*ptr))
00241           ptr++;
00242 
00243         if (strncmp(ptr, "/*", 2))
00244           break;
00245       }
00246 
00247     }
00248 
00249     codeStart = ptr;
00250 
00251     for (size_t i=0; i<exchange_strings.size(); i++) {
00252       base = codeStart;
00253       while ((ptr = strstr(base, exchange_strings[i].first.c_str())) != 0) {
00254         rinfo.offset = ptr - fcontents;
00255         rinfo.fromString = exchange_strings[i].first.c_str();
00256         rinfo.toString = exchange_strings[i].second.c_str();
00257         riVec.push_back(rinfo);
00258         base = ptr + strlen(exchange_strings[i].first.c_str());
00259       }
00260     }
00261 
00262     if (!riVec.empty()) {
00263       ltReplaceInfo ltObj;      
00264       sort(riVec.begin(), riVec.end(), ltObj);
00265     }
00266 
00267     lastOffset = codeStart - fcontents;
00268     for (size_t i=0; i<riVec.size(); i++) {
00269       cerr << "Replace at offset " << riVec[i].offset << endl << flush;
00270       converted_contents += string(fcontents + lastOffset, riVec[i].offset-lastOffset);
00271       converted_contents += riVec[i].toString;
00272       lastOffset = riVec[i].offset + strlen(riVec[i].fromString);
00273     }
00274 
00275     converted_contents += string(fcontents + lastOffset, flen-lastOffset);
00276 
00277     return true;
00278   }
00279 
00280 }
